description:
What could possibly be more fun than going out into an untamed wilderness, slaughtering dozens of terrifying creatures, then eating them and wearing their skin? Nothing! Which is probably why Monster Hunter Wilds is currently number one with a bullet arrow made from dragon fangs on the Steam charts even before it’s out. And if you buy some new gear from AMD, you can get it for free.

The latest freebie game for CPU and graphics card buyers is Capcom’s hotly-anticipated sequel to Monster Hunter: World. AMD will give you a free game code if you buy one of the following Ryzen CPUs:

  • Ryzen 9 9950X
  • Ryzen 9 9900X
  • Ryzen 7 9700X
  • Ryzen 5 9600X
  • Ryzen 9 7950X
  • R
title: New AMD CPUs and GPUs come with free Monster Hunter Wilds

description:
Microsoft is currently rolling out a new optional update for Windows 11 24H2. Update KB5052093 brings some new features, but also adds some self-promotion to the system with Microsoft placing a banner in the system settings to emphasize Game Pass.

Let’s dive into the more notable changes.

New camera options

This update introduces a new camera control in Windows 11 that no longer limits a camera to being used by just one app at a time.

To test this, you can call up the “Advanced camera options” in Settings > Bluetooth & devices > Cameras. With the option “Allow multiple apps to use the camera at the same t
title: Optional Windows 11 24H2 update brings fixes and more advertising

description:
Google is changing how Chrome extensions work on the desktop and Chromebooks. While the Manifest V3 changes are billed as ways to improve safety and efficiency, the way they also limit how adblocking extensions like uBlock Origin work has drawn a lot of criticism. And now, uBlock Origin is dead on Chrome (along with any other Manifest v2 extensions).

I’m sure the fact that Google is the world’s biggest advertising company has nothing to do with it. 

Personally I’d recommend changing browsers<
title: uBlock Origin is dead, but these 4 ad blockers still work with Chrome

description:
This Baseus charging station is pretty much all you need to have on your desk, delivering outlets, ports, and even a magnetic charging pad. The best part? We have a special discount code for you, letting you snag this for under $50 instead of its $90 MSRP.

The Baseus Nomos is listed with a 24 percent discount, but you can bring that down even further with code I9XXRRTR at checkout, slashing the price by an additional $18 and change.

What makes this charging station special? It eliminates the need for power strips and other charging accessories, allowing you to have a better-organized desk. It has three AC outlets, plus three USB-C and a USB-A port on the sides, plus a MagSafe wireless charging pad for Qi2-certified devices (i.e.,
title: Grab this 8-device charging station for your desk while it’s 44% off

description:
Laptops are great if you need portability, but these days you can get the same performance with a mini PC while saving a bunch of money and taking up less space on your desk.

For example, this Bosgame P3 mini PC is darn powerful and it’s only $330 right now on Amazon, down from its original $400 with a Prime membership. (Don’t have Prime? Grab a free 30-day trial and you can score this special price, plus unlock the other perks of Prime.)

The Bosgame P3 is ready to take on anything you need to get done on the daily. It’s equipped with an impressive AMD Ryzen 9 6900HX processor and 16GB of DDR5 RAM as well as a 512GB SSD. That’s a worthwhile config that’ll breeze through any task, from the small stuff
title: This Ryzen 9 mini PC with triple 4K power is only $330 right now

description:
TL;DR: A lifetime subscription to AdGuard’s ad blocker and malware protection software is on sale for $15.97 with code GUARD20 at checkout (reg. $39.99).

The internet isn’t what it used to be. Ads chase you from site to site, pop-ups interrupt every click, and it feels like you’re being watched (you very well might be). AdGuard is here to bring the glory days of the internet back:
title: This brings the good ol’ days of the internet back
